item.title: Off topic: Survey of medicine usage in Australia
item.description:
A national census of medicines use: a 24-hour snapshot of Australians aged 50 years and older

Tessa K Morgan, Margaret Williamson, Marie Pirotta, Kay Stewart, Stephen P Myers and Joanne Barnes

Med J Aust 2012; 196 (1): 50-53.

Objective: To explore the current use of conventional and complementary medicines in Australians aged ? 50 years.

Design, setting and participants: Cross-sectional postal survey sent to a random sample of 4500 Australians aged ? 50 years between June 2009 and February 2010.

item.title: Ways to block UVA but not the UVB which makes vitamin D
item.description:
There appear to be several ways to block damaging UVA while passing the UVB which provides vitamin D and long term tanning

  1. Pill with natural antioxidents

  2. Cream with natural antioxidents

  3. A special sunscreen which blocks UVA, but not UVB

1. 1

In Jan 2012 I became aware of a pill which provides some protection of damage of the skin from the sun.

The pill contains natural antioxidents which reduce skin damage for both UVA and UVB rays WITHOUT decreasing the amount of UVB (read that as Vitamin D) that the skin receives.

item.title: Fertility problem (PCOS) reduced by vitamin D, etc: many studies
item.description:
• PCOS risk decreased 27% by Omega-3 (Mendelian study) – Sept 2024
      • PCOS treatment needs about 3,000 IU of Vitamin D - meta-analysis Sept 2024
      • Need more PCOS studies with >3,000 IU dosing - meta-analysis Sept 2023
      • PCOS and vitamin D: a clinical appraisal - Sept 2023
      • PCOS is more than just a fertility problem - PCOS reduces longevity by 1 year - 2023
      • PCOS appears to be helped by Vitamn D, probiotics, Omega-3, etc - meta-analysis Sept 2022
      • PCOS Physiopathology and Vitamin D Deficiency - Aug 2022
      • PCOS - menstrual frequency improved by 50,000 IU Vitamin D/week & low calorie diet - RCT May 2018
      • PCOS problems reduced by Vitamin D plus Omega-3 – RCT June 2018
      • PCOS – Live birth strongly a function of vitamin D level – RCT May 2016
      • PCOS decreased by 2.3 X with Vitamin D - meta-analysis Feb 2017
      • PCOS problems greatly reduced by Vitamin D (50,000 IU weekly) – Oct 2015
      • Therapeutic implications of vitamin D and calcium in overweight women with polycystic ovary syndrome. (8500 IU, 2012)
      • Vitamin D seems to have helped PCOS somewhat (2012)
      • Probable connection: antimüllerian hormone levels - April 2014 50,000 IU weekly helped
      • > 30 ng recommended to reduce PCOS (June 2014)
      • PCOS may be due to being overweight - Turkey (which also has low Vit D) Oct 2014
      • Wikipedia highlights on PCOS
      • PCOS decreased by Magnesium, Zinc, Calcium, and 200 IU of VitaminD - March 2018
      • PCOS treatment by Vitamin D is aided by Metformin - meta-analysis Feb 2024
      • See also web

PCOS risk decreased 27% by Omega-3 (Mendelian study) – Sept 2024

Causal relationship between fertility nutrients supplementation and PCOS risk: a Mendelian randomization study

item.title: Overview Schizophrenia and Vitamin D
item.description:
15 reasons to think that schizophrenia is associated with low vitamin D

  1. 97% of patients with schizophrenia are vitamin D deficient

  2. Schizophrenia varies with latitude (UVB) by 10X (controversy)

  3. Schizophrenia is more common in those with dark skin (when away from the equator)

  4. Schizophrenia is associated with low natal vitamin D

  5. Schizophrenia has been increasing around the world when vitamin D has been decreasing (controversy)

  6. Schizophrenia is associated with low birth rate, which is associated with low vitamin D
